Title.evidence: NEON Study: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicentre, double-blind, randomised controlled trial was conducted across 17 NHS hospitals in the UK.

Participants.evidence: Participants aged 18 and over with unilateral digital nerve injuries were randomised 1:1 to either microsurgical suture repair or nerve alignment alone.

Intervention.evidence: Participants aged 18 and over with unilateral digital nerve injuries were randomised 1:1 to either microsurgical suture repair or nerve alignment alone.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the superiority of suture repair over alignment alone.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the Impact of Hand Nerve Disorders (I-HaND v2) patient-reported outcome measure at 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment, and both participants and assessors were blinded.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment, and both participants and assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between September 2020 and November 2022, 122 participants were randomised, 61 to each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Primary outcome data were available for 106 participants (87%).

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found in I-HaND scores at 12 months (mean difference = 4.3, 95% CI [-0.9, 10.8], p = 0.09).
